snippet: Market makers who once might have stepped in during trading mishaps have largely been replaced by computers programmed to make lucrative high-frequency trades.
abstract: News analysis; market makers who once might have stepped in during trading mishaps have largely been replaced by computers programmed to make lucrative high-frequency trades, as evidenced by the recent Knight Capital Group incident; improved markets are more prone to disaster, and with technological innovation continuing apace, the risks may have increased.
lead_paragraph: Market makers who once might have stepped in during trading mishaps have largely been replaced by computers programmed to make lucrative high-frequency trades.

headline.seo: Computers Trade Quickly, but Leave No Time to Think
headline.main: Strong and Fast Markets, but No Time to Think
headline.print_headline: An Automated Jolt for the Markets: Strong and Fast, But No Time to Think
